learning_outcomes.description: Represent and manipulate simple economic models algebraically.
Use differential calculus, including partial derivatives and differentials, across a range of economic problems.
Apply integration techniques to economic concepts such as consumer surplus and producer surplus.
Apply methods of unconstrained and constrained optimization to simple economic problems.
Use matrix algebra to solve sets of simultaneous equations and simple input-output models.

assessments.due_date:
6/09/2024 - 13/09/2024

Assignment 1 will be released at 10 am on Friday, 6 September, and is due by 4 pm on Friday, 13 September.
assessments.task_description:
The assignment will be a series of problems that test students' knowledge of the topics covered in workshops and tutorials. Assignment 1 will cover material from Topics 1 to 6.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must be handwritten and legible. Scan the assignment (scanners are available at the Library) and create ONE PDF document. Examine your PDF document prior to submission to ensure it is legible and complete. Submit online through Learn.UQ (Blackboard) Turnitin. More details will be provided on Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
18/10/2024 - 25/10/2024

Assignment 2 will be released at 10 am on Friday, 18 October, and is due by 4 pm on Friday, 25 October.
assessments.task_description:
The assignment will be a series of problems that test students' knowledge of the topics covered in workshops and tutorials. Assignment 2 will cover material from Topics 3 to 10 (although this material is dependent on earlier topics as well).

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must be handwritten and legible. Scan the assignment (scanners are available at the Library) and create ONE PDF document. Examine your PDF document prior to submission to ensure it is legible and complete. Submit online through Learn.UQ (Blackboard) Turnitin. More details will be provided on Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The two-hour written exam will cover Topics 1 to 12, i.e., all topics from the course.

The final exam will be held during the examination period at a time and place set by Central Exams. Important reminders and notices will be posted on Learn.UQ (Blackboard).

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
